translation.line: ... I shall honor...
klaṣt was sent to the elders: two piculs. Raw...
... piculs. On day thirteen in the morning, the coppāṃ cor ... elders...
wsok was spent: two pints 2. klaṣt was spent: 6 pār
wsok was spent: 7 pints. āru... was spent...

comments.comment: Ogihara argues that that coppāṃ is the equivalent to Chinese 处半, Old Turk. čupan, Bactr. σωπανο, Khot. chaupaṃ. cor is most definitely an Old Turkic title.

line.tr: towards the (di)rections having made irge (?), thus towards the northern dir(ection) ...
... the roofs(?) pertaining to the chickens ...

comments.comment: One of the most archaic Tocharian manuscripts that still shows the older leftward-bound 〈e〉 and 〈ai〉; see .

line.tr: ... should be (learned). [The other] (monks should be asked.) ///
(if) he listens closely to the monks ///
in a decisive [gathering] of the community about the law ///
(If) a monk scorns a monk, Pāt. ///
(If) a monk, when the time has passed, (without asking permission) to a present monk ///
he is a family associate in several single houses, late ///
he goes to the palace of the king ///

The beings laboured like fish on land.

translation.line: ?-ṣkuneke*的僧伽对Nāri将军致以祝福：大人！（正如）您自己完全了解（的），（您）自己的父亲的僧伽蓝（现在）属于你。......
现在僧伽增长了，因此工匠们停留（在这里）。他们正在为 Śimpraye* 的窗子做栏杆（？）。我们用完了粮食。现在......。
我们有很好的勤行。现在，我们怀着期盼写给您：即使是以一些谷物（的形式），您本来已经应该（为我们）做出一些贡献！在其他许多寺院中......（做出）[进步]
这里，您确实有必要谋求并且关切（字面义为“过问”）（住）在 Iśśapake* 建造的寺院里的僧伽的甘苦。现在，怀着希望，[我们恭敬地写给您]......
之后......布施......十石粮食。那么这里（便得以）确实因为您自身的力量，众僧将能够勤修向善......。将会为您做......随之，向僧坊......
The saṅgha of ?-ṣkuneke honors the general Nāri. Lord, you yourself know this fully: you have the saṅgha of your own father...
Now, the saṅgha is growing. Likewise artisans are in the process of building balconies for the window of Śimpraye . They/we (?) are lacking grain. Now...
We have good zeal. Now we speak with trust to you: With a little grain you would be doing something excellent. In many other monasteries... excellence...
It is necessary for you to seek and ask for the happiness and suffering of the saṅgha . In the monastery made by Iśśapake, now with trust... good...
The final donation: ten piculs grain, so that it will be suitable here for the saṅgha to practice zeal and good morals in your power...
... will be made by you.

comments.comment: I interpret ṣameṃ... laṃssenträ as a serial verb construction that adds progressive aspect. cf. Sanskrit, where the root sthā- can be used as 'Ausdruck der im Gange befindlichen Handlung' (). Śimpraye is almost certainly related to śimprāyai in Ot 12 a1. However, the relationship between the two forms and their meaning is unclear.
For ritatsi parktsi, cf. PK AS 8C a6 and PK NS 274. Collocation of rit- and pärk- seems to have been idiomatic.
